website_summaries.verdict: SanDisk's tongue-twister of an MP3 player is a stupefying value and its practical clip-on design is perfect for the gym.
pros: The SanDisk Sansa Clip Zip is an audio Swiss Army Knife that plays most audio formats, works with audiobook and subscription music services, can be used as a voice recorder, and tunes in to FM radio--all for under $50
cons: You get what you pay for in terms of construction quality

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, compact, minimum-frills MP3 player
customer_reviews.text: In a market dominated by ever-more-powerful phones and electronics, simplicity is a definite plus. And, while just about any smartphone can do the job of any MP3 player, having a dedicated MP3 player definitely simplifies what you need to have with you, say, at the gym. SanDisk's Sansa player series is an excellent MP3 player, at an excellent price, and with a form factor roughly 1/6th that of my smartphone, making it far easier to carry and maintain while doing weightlifting at the gym. I have this MP3 player attached to the brim of a boonie hat, with some basic earbuds wove through the loops around the base of the boonie hat for cord management.
customer_reviews.author: E. Hess

customer_reviews.title: More than I hoped for!
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my old Sansa MP3 (which worked great for years) because I wanted to differentiate between music and audiobooks. Not only does this device have a separate audiobook folder--it keeps separate bookmarks for each book I have on the player. Recently took it to the beach and was thrilled at it's performance for both music and books. It's super easy to navigate and use in general (pausing, finding music, playlists). Will never lose the orange player in my purse either! Would highly recommend it! Excellent sound quality and value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: MamaRio

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for the money--but beware....
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice,compact little MP3 player...easy to use, attractive and works great. One thing though---included in the package is a mini-disc from "Rhapsody", an on-line music download company. The instructions that come with the Rhapsody disc make it sound like you MUST install Rhapsody in order to use the SanDisk MP3 player. BEWARE!!!! It's only a ploy to force you to use Rhapsody !!! As a matter of fact, I tried to install the Rhapsody disc...and got it stuck in my disc-drive,forcing me to have the disc-drive replaced. I have contacted SanDisk and asked them to remove the Rhapsody disc from future packaging. Ignore the Rhapsody disc and everything will be fine !!!!
customer_reviews.author: Joan E. Ebberts

customer_reviews.title: One will need one of the Android or IOS or Kindle Fire like devices which run an operating system and can support ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this player because it would play Protected/Secure/DRM WMA audiobooks. It does. Unfortunately, OneClickDigital, a library affiliate that provides audiobooks in Protected WMA format just mentioned to me that Windows will be not allowing Protected WMA books to be downloaded into portable devices such as this. One will need one of the Android or IOS or Kindle Fire like devices which run an operating system and can support apps. Boy, I had this device for 10 whole days before it was obsolete!
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: The Original Clip+ Is Better
customer_reviews.text: Buyer beware. The Clip Zip has several annoying features: 1. Skip-Forward (>>) and Skip-Back (<<) take a very long time (6-7 seconds) to actually do anything. This makes the Clip Zip very frustrating to use. 2. It sometimes (okay, lots of times) skips forward multiple songs from just one keypress. Sometimes, skipping forward does nothing at all. 3. The sansa updater software is incredibly annoying. It pops up a lot, has all sorts of pointless warnings, and won't close. I have to go into task manager to manually kill its process. I also own a Clip+, and that Clip+ is far superior. I still use the Clip+, never the Clip Zip.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt

customer_reviews.title: Great price-performance
customer_reviews.text: I found this to have a great price-performance; I am happy with the purchase. * Pro's: Good price, easy to add memory, easy to use, I can copy files right to the unit, can play music by folder, straightforward. * Con's: USB cable is a bit short (but workable) and you cannot charge the unit and use it at the same time. Note: I bought the 4GB unit and added 32GB of microSD (SanDisk Ultra 32 GB MicroSDHC C10/UHS1 Memory Card). I ended up putting my favorites (singles) in the 4GB internal memory and the full blown music library on the microSD. I bought the 4GB plus 32 GB microSD for the same cost at the 8GB model.
customer_reviews.author: DeathSpiral

customer_reviews.title: Get what you pay for + warranty useless
customer_reviews.text: Complete waste of money. It worked well for about three months then suddenly it will only load about one in every ten audio files I try to put on it, and it started squirreling them away in unusual sub-sub-sub-folders. I did not change a single thing about the types of files I was putting on there (mp3s from my own collection + regular podcasts) or the program I used to put them on there. I thought I was safe since I paid good money to get the warranty tacked on, but after I submitted a claim they said they will only cover physical damage to the item, and if there's anything wrong internally you're just out of luck.
customer_reviews.author: Wm R

customer_reviews.title: Sad to say but the SanDisk Sansa line are the ...
customer_reviews.text: Sad to say but the SanDisk Sansa line are the only low price MP3 players still around. They are flaky cheap junk but there doesn't seem anything to be anything between them and the various exotic $200-500 high end models. If only there was a new line of Rio Carbon with a solid state HD, they had incredible sound and a superb operating system with multiple bookmarks features and easy to use interface. Great for audiobooks and music. I am not counting iPods as are they are cheap overpriced junk too
customer_reviews.author: R. Walker

customer_reviews.title: Cute player but just ok performace :(
customer_reviews.text: It worked fantastic for about 6 months then started having issues, turning itself off with full battery...not turning on at all for like 6 days then suddenly working again. Also super short battery life, every year we drive 13 -14 hours full trip to pick up my husbands older kiddos for summer and the silly thing doesn't even last half way with a fully charged battery when my other player I replaced this one with would go DAYS with out needing a charge...VERY disappointed with the short battery life :(
customer_reviews.author: lilaughingwolf

customer_reviews.title: Sansa Clips are a Reliable & Great Value
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased this for both of my Senior parents, and they both love it. My mother, who is not great with technology, found it easy to use and charge, though she has struggled a bit with adding music to it. Hers has lasted a number of years (she has a previous version) and survived a few drops well. She power walks with the clip and it stays on well. Dad also loves the durability, the simplicity of the interface, and the small size for travel. I purchased for around $35 and have found them an incredible value for the price. I'd recommend any version of the Sansa Clip.
customer_reviews.author: austenfitzgerald

customer_reviews.title: shuffle alternative
customer_reviews.text: Just wanted to escape the Apple monopoly--ironic as yes I am writing this on one. Super, super easy to use. Literally just clicked on the file and dragged my selections for iTunes to it. In spite of the instructions, did not need to download anything to make this happen. Although a small screen, it beats the non-screen option of similarly priced items. It even came with ear buds which sound really good. Have since downgraded to two stars. I guess I was star struck until it was time to edit and add things--all it does now is freeze--and you will find too many websites dedicated to trying to solve issues--none appear to be quick fixes.
customer_reviews.author: Bob HYN

customer_reviews.title: it was a nice thing to have while jogging
customer_reviews.text: Beware of the battery problems! I purchased one of these less than 2 years ago. While it was working, it was a nice thing to have while jogging, exercising, etc. But when the battery failed, the big problems began. Just look up "replace battery for Sansa Clip" online. You quickly will understand why. Basically unless you are an electronics technician, or just someone who loves to work with soldering,mini-screwdrivers and such, you will soon find the the ONLY choice you will have is to replace the Sansa Clip. I am done with this, and my new rule is Never Buy a battery operated device again without checking online first to see if the battery can be replaced.
customer_reviews.author: MR C.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic device, love it
customer_reviews.text: With its shuffle, expandable memory, back-clip, and very simple interface, this is the best way to stick it to the Apple users and have your own nice MP3 player. It plays WMAs, too, which is grand--they're usually smaller than MP3s, which means you can fit even MORE music on there! No need to fiddle with annoying programs just to use it, either--drag and drop works great. However, the blue is not very...blue. It's almost a purpleish blue. But, hey...it's a great player. So who cares? I love this thing. It also happens to charge with the same kind of USB cord that my phone uses.... So it's easier to keep up with! Bonus! (It's a very easy-to-find size.)
customer_reviews.author: Kacie Hughes

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for I guess
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to get this little device. I checked reviews on Amazon as well as Consumer Reports. I am sorry to say that is player really did not work well right out of the box. The music skips and the head phone port does not work well either. I tried not only the head phones supplied but also two other sets that I have. The head phones cut in and out and you have to wiggle the end to get sound. Music skips, cutting in and out. This is part of the player since the stop and start are synced. All in all I would not replace it with the same player. Buyer beware. Returning. BOO
customer_reviews.author: CAT ANN

customer_reviews.title: Small but Great
customer_reviews.text: This is the best MP3 player that I've ever used. It's small, light, affordable, and customizable. This is great for all kinds of situation whether it be for working out or walking to class. I bought the 4GB model which is pretty small if you have lots of high quality music. There is also an 8GB version which is a little bit bigger. Regardless, the great thing about this is that you can put in a micro SD card to increase storage. There's multiple colors if you like that option. I had an ipod before which was great, but this is so much better because it's cheaper, upgradeable, and you don't have to install proprietary software like itunes. 10/10
customer_reviews.author: Kollan

customer_reviews.title: I am not sure if I am running into bad batches or what with these
customer_reviews.text: This is the second SanDisk Sansa Clip Zip I have purchased. I am not sure if I am running into bad batches or what with these. Both clips had battery issues. Within a month, the batteries wouldn't hold more than a 15 minute charge (even though they said 100% charge status). Eventually, one stopped working all together and the other stopped charging. This is within 4 months of owning both devices. When my Sansa was working, it was a champ and was a great little device. I have friends with the same device, same model, and they are having zero problems with the item. I think I am just going to pass on a Clip #3 and find another device.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck B.

customer_reviews.title: great player for audio books
customer_reviews.text: I own two of these, and I have to say that are a little buggy compared to the previous version of this player, but this new one has some nice features and the color screen is fun! Recommended as a great player for audio books! Note: To have the player bookmark your spot in the book you are reading, make sure the book files are saved in the “Audiobook” folder within the player. Second Note: To make a playlist, add all the songs you want into a folder within the “Playlist” folder, then highlight ALL the songs, and right-mouse-click to choose “Create Playlist”. Then name the playlist and you are all set.
customer_reviews.author: Starr Green

customer_reviews.title: I love this MP3 player
customer_reviews.text: I love this MP3 player. I use it for running because it's lightweight and clips directly to my shirt leaving me free to run without having to worry about an arm pouch or waist belt that can store it. I've run with it in summer and in winter and even for ten miles of rain where it was only partially protected by a running jacket that was soaked through by the end. I would recommend this to anyone who wants a hearty MP3 player that can handle daily abuse.
customer_reviews.author: A. Moore

customer_reviews.title: Some glitches
customer_reviews.text: I have an old Sansa MP3 that I have had for 5 or 6 years. It is heavy and doesn't have a clip. However, everything I loaded onto it was easy to find. No slippage of categories. For example, I listen to a lot of podcasts. With the Sansa Clip, instead of loading only to the Podcast category, they load to the Music section as well as Podcast. So---my Music category is confusingly full of other stuff. The Sansa Clip size and weight are nice. I like being able to clip to my shirt instead of needing to wear something with a pocket. I'm giving my old one to my husband, who always has a pocket. :)
customer_reviews.author: Super Sue

customer_reviews.title: My second one just broke and fragged a 32gb micro sd
customer_reviews.text: I really liked my first one, because it is small enough to be almost unnoticeable while running or working out. Unfortunately it inexplicably broke after about 3 months. Amazon replaced it free. The second lasted about six months before it completely bricked. It was not covered by warranty, but sandisk replaced it for me after about three hours on chat and the phone. The third one just broke (constantly says refreshing content and powers off and won't turn back on without a hard reboot). When the last one broke, it corrupted all the data on my 32gb sd card. I've yet to see if I can reformat and reuse the drive. These things are pieces junk.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey D. Duby

customer_reviews.title: Tricky to create and name folders properly
customer_reviews.text: I bought this one because it supports microSD card and looks simple to copy music from a computer to the player. Everything looks good except creating the folders for songs. There are 2 different modes for USB connection. I just used the default one to connect the player to my computer and then created the folders. After disconnecting the USB cable, I found that the names of some folders were displayed with strange characters. It took me hours to figure out the reason. Pros: Lightweight, expansion slot for microSD card, simple file transfer between player and PC, 10-hour music playing, standard charging via USB port, acceptable price Cons: Tricky to create and name folders properly
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: it is a great, durable unit
customer_reviews.text: I much prefer the clip+. The Clip Zip is slow to turn on, slow to skip/repeat, and requires a wake-up before you can turn it off. It is frequently getting stuck in an undesired menu, which doesn't happen to me on the Clip+. The color screen doesn't add value for me, and is more difficult to read than the OLED screen on the Clip+. Otherwise, it is a great, durable unit, with only minor drawbacks. The battery last all day and then some. My clip+ is about 4 years old, the Clip Zip about 2 years, and the battery is still strong in both units. Both units have been abused a bit at work, but haven't failed.
customer_reviews.author: Player Two

customer_reviews.title: Risky Choice
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in April '13 and was initially thrilled -- used the Music and FM options frequently when running or working around the yard. It's small, lite weight, and the functionality is great. However it does not stand the test of time (as many others have found). The clip broke within 7 weeks (and the clip is a very useful feature). After about 6 weeks I started having the 'frozen screen' problem. Usually rebooting (repeatedly) can get some functions working, but the problem is getting worse. Overall, a great conceptual design but poor execution in the production/implementation. I'm giving up on mine and looking for a better product. I cannot recommend this product for anyone.
customer_reviews.author: rgc97

customer_reviews.title: great little mp3 player
customer_reviews.text: These are great little mp3 players - I bought this as a backup for my current one, as it's been discontinued and the newer ones don't have DRM which I need. The battery life is excellent and they keep on trucking. I did have to reformat one once, but otherwise they never seem to have problems and work intuitively. Also includes a voice recorder and FM radio. The clip is nice so that I can clip it to something while I'm using it and not have to purchase an extra strap or accessory.
customer_reviews.author: SueO

customer_reviews.title: Works great for audiobooks
customer_reviews.text: I bought this primarily for listening to audio books. It works great--remembers where you were. Highly recommended. Used it with Audible files (using the Audible Manager loader). Can also use it with mp3 audio books by just copying the file to the Audiobook folder. Just an update after using it a couple of months. This is really the best mp3 player I've ever used. It remembers where you where and asks "resume or restart". It does a great job organizing podcasts and you don't have to do anything special--it takes care of it. Battery lasts a real long time (they say 18 hours)
customer_reviews.author: Mike C

customer_reviews.title: The sound was good but I had to return it and I don't plan on buying another one
customer_reviews.text: The unit I received didn't work so I sent it back. I've been using a Zen from Creative for over six years which I like but its battery is not holding a charge as it should anylonger so I thought I would try a SanDisk after reading some good reviews and not really appreciating where Creative has gone with the Zen. The physical quality didn't feel all that good but most of the features worked except my computer wouldn't recognize it even after going to the SanDisk site which is helpful, there I read the exact description of my experience which advised to return the unit because its defective, that's why I give it two stars.
customer_reviews.author: sgrams

customer_reviews.title: PRICE GOUGING!! But excellent product. Would not buy for anything more than 40$ TOTAL.
customer_reviews.text: Great little player. Bought mine in 2012. FOR 60$, the sellers here are totally ripping you off here. Perhaps as some vintage item value or something, though this is unlikely. There are plenty of new models for less than 40$ which are equivalent but better given they are newer and their batteries were likely manufactured more recently. WOULD NOT RECOMMEND FOR MORE THAN 40$!!
customer_reviews.author: Zjwillie

customer_reviews.title: but nice. It does its job
customer_reviews.text: cheap, but nice. It does its job. The sound quality is nice, and this thing is easy to navigate. It has a radio, which is a nice plus. I don't use it that much, because I'm used to my android phone with spotify, but from time to time this thing is nice to have (like when you're cleaning the house, or working out). Oh, and it's a nice gift. I gave one of these to my dad. He can't handle newer technologies, like the magical touch screens. I tried giving him an android phone and he hates it, but he loves this thing, because it has buttons. Physical buttons are something older people understand.
customer_reviews.author: L. Orozco

customer_reviews.title: A great FLAC player!
customer_reviews.text: I love this little "FLAC" player! Very simple to use and the fact that it uses many audio codecs other than MP3 like FLAC is worth its price tag! I have been using it every day since I got it, and I truly don't leave home without it. * I did have an an issue with it playing certain FLAC files that would cause the player to freeze, shut off or just restart on its own. The cause of it was using the latest firmware provided that gave me problems...I then re-loaded the previous firmware and haven't had an issue since! It's great really!
customer_reviews.author: R. Mercado

customer_reviews.title: Great product and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: The battery life is great. Volume and sound quality is great. I love the different colors and the layout of the front buttons. It is easy to add music and audiobooks from my computer. I use MediaPlayer for music and Overdrive Media Console to add audiobooks. For audiobooks to correctly add to the SanDisk Audiobook section, I had to make sure I selected the audiobook option in Overdrive. Otherwise, the audiobook goes to the Music section of the SanDisk. I like the clip on the back and it's small size ... I just clip it to my shirt and I am ready to exercise. Wonderful player for a great price!
customer_reviews.author: Butters

customer_reviews.title: Drops Songs
customer_reviews.text: Cons: Display is so tiny and not easy to use. Battery life only lasts 5 Hours and then dies. Short Battery life. Most importantly - it dropped songs out of the memory. It was defective. I exchanged it and the new one holds onto the songs, but still dismal battery life. Pros: Small Lightweight Cheap (but you get what you pay for) Bottom Line: I bought an iPod because I wasn't happy with this MP3 Player. Kind of a waste of money. I use it as my backup, but not my main one. I bought it because the literature said the battery life lasts 15 hours. I did not find this to be true.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Erskine

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful evolution from the Clip+
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful evolution from the Clip+. Couldn't expect more for 50 bucks. Sound is great (even better than most of the smartphones nowadays). Only downside is that the software is not as fast as on the Clip+ though it's reasonable with this having color and images.
customer_reviews.author: Jay M

customer_reviews.title: I like it but.....
customer_reviews.text: I ordered and received the Sandisk ClipZip last June. I love the device, it worked great for exercising until last May when it just stopped working. Not even holding down the power button for 30 seconds would work. I let Amazon know, and they replaced it in just a day or two, Great!!. But the new one just stopped working. The 30 second reset does not work, and I am 20 days outside the warranty. I sent an e-mail to Amazon, and waiting for a response. Does anyone know another MP3 player in the same price range that is more reliable? I don't want an Apple Nano, as I can't add a flash card to it.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Bennett

customer_reviews.title: ... in some of the comments you could convert and easily use with Itunes
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately though I read in some of the comments you could convert and easily use with Itunes...."EASILY" is very subjective. I have a large library in my itunes. I have spent 2 hours searching programs and looking for how to do this other than burning to a CD, then burning to the player - or converting each song to MP3 via itunes and then trying to find WHERE in the the computer it went.......yikes. I really didnt want to spend the money on an "i" device especially when they are so large and I dont like the newer models. However, I refuse to spend any more time trying to figure this out. Bummer :(
customer_reviews.author: Seattle Kitten

customer_reviews.title: Did not last long.
customer_reviews.text: I took a shot and purchased despite the reviews. Bad decision... It last three weeks. It did have good sound quality but battery died I put on charge and when I went to use would not turn on .It was the same problem other reviewers had I am going to chuck in trash as Amazon return date has passed and I will not pay to have it returned to SanDisc. This is not the first time I have had problems with a SanDisk product. Will not purchase anything from them again. Quality control be damned. If that many people have the same problem they should recall and give people their money back. Amazon should stop selling this crap..
customer_reviews.author: Rageous

customer_reviews.title: recommend buying for musicians and bikers
customer_reviews.text: a nice unit that clips anywhere and has adequate functions. harder to read without glasses compared to larger screen types. I use it when biking(clip to shirt) and when learning new music (clip to music stand). worth buying. ***update. on/off switch failed in the on position sept 2015. Unit was not used very often yet only lasted 1 1/2 years. This is the second sansa mp3 I have purchased in the last 3 years. The first one "fuze" failed due to 3.5mm connector going bad. I just bought a sony, we'll see how it compares
customer_reviews.author: pat napolitano

customer_reviews.title: Nice compact MP3 player; great price.
customer_reviews.text: Great product for the price. Easy-to-use controls. Reasonably weather-resistant (I cycle-commute rain or shine). Good battery life and durable casing. The micro-SD card slot is a nice feature. My one complaint is with the firmware. I create my own sub-folders in the podcast folder of the internal memory, but the firmware does not organize and display these folders and their content in the same way as they were created on my desktop computer. The translation is just off, and SanDisk just doesn't seem able or willing to fix it (yet).
customer_reviews.author: Travis Idol

customer_reviews.title: Great when it was working
customer_reviews.text: I thought this was a fantastic product when I first bought it. Sound quality was better than what was coming out of my android phone and it has a built in equalizer among many other features. Size and weight was great and it played well with a 32gb microSD card. I haven't quite used it much which is why I am shocked that the Zip has already failed me after 1 year and 4 months of ownership. Just today it stopped turning on. Update: I'm an idiot. So I thought it was broken but in order to restart the device you have to hold down the power button for about 30 seconds and then it will restart itself.
customer_reviews.author: Gold Fish Lung

customer_reviews.title: Case cracked
customer_reviews.text: OK, trying to use the clip a little strongly will not break the clip but will crack the case! You will not see straight sharp line when it cracks, because the case seems to be made of plastic that is somewhat, malleable. Otherwise the player is great. Loaded some FLACS and added a 8GG microSD, and am a happy camper. See my review of the iGrado. Don't waste your time trying so many headphones! I came to the conclusion that the best earbuds are the ones with higher/lower frequency responses than 20hz-20Khz. Got the Sony MDREX36V/BLK earbuds, on sale for $12 (6hz-23Khz)!!! Now, I'll see if I get get some cheap ones that go to 25KHz or higher. Any recommendations?
customer_reviews.author: Tomasa Tomasa

customer_reviews.title: Decent little player
customer_reviews.text: I got this MP3 player due to my ancient (iRiver H340) MP3 player dying on me. I was looking for something light weight with a color screen, expandable memory and easy navigation controls. Seemed to fit all of my requirements nicely. Maybe I'm just crazy, but Sandisk says there's about 15 hours of battery life, but I swear I've used it for 24+ hours without the need for a charge (with fairly decent volume using Grado SR80 headphones). The EQ is a nice touch and isn't overly technical. Audio quality is great, Sandisk has employed great DAC's for quite a while. Internally, this thing is identical to the Sansa Clip+ which got quite a following due to it's circuitry.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald Loffelbein

customer_reviews.title: earphone jack fix, I use it for wma books only
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this player 3 weeks ago. My interests were wma library books-which it does very well via OverDrive. My only problem with it is the infamous loose earphone jack. That problem has been described many times here in these reviews. I figured that if I sent it back, I'd get another loose connecting player, so I fixed it. I simply used a rubberband to tighten the ear phones to the earphone jack. A side benefit is that the rubberband also protects the open usb port from dust and dirt. Problem fixed. I'm enjoying my 4th audio book. So far, so good. If that jack wasn't so poorly made, I'd give the player a 5* rating (for audio books).
customer_reviews.author: J. B. Langley

customer_reviews.title: Best product of its category
customer_reviews.text: I'm a big fan of their products, for less than 50 dollars, you can't find better: + Excellent sound (of course, depending of your mp3's quality...) + Easy, simple to use + Radio fm (you can even record the radio live) + Voice Recorder + Can add memory cards to increase stockage (at this price, it's fabulous!) + Drag and drop your files like using a memory stick! + Lots of formats are supported (mp3, but also ogg and even lossless formats!) - simple minimalist design (and a bit cheap) - bad screen definition, definitively made for listening music, that's it. I love it; good luck if you want to find better at this price!
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Does everything I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure what to say about this, except that the most important feature is that it's firmware is MUCH better than the previous version, the Clip+. On the previous model, I felt it was necessary to install Rockbox custom firmware to get the most use out of it. With this model, I don't need to bother. It plays MP3s, a bunch of other formats, has a much more legible screen (even out on a bright snowy mountain), and maintains the previous models long, long battery life. Would definitely recommend to any other dinosaurs still looking for a standalone music player! :)
customer_reviews.author: jesbek

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little MP3 Player!
customer_reviews.text: I have had a SanDisk MP3 player before, I liked it, but I love this one (kind of think they could have put better demonstrator tracks on it)! But a note the headphones that come with this are BUNK, JUNK, and TOTALLY SUCK! But a simple pair of Skullcandy Scope 2XL ear-buds made it come to life. And for a $7.49 investment for some at Office Depot, made this well worth it. The screen a little small for watching video, or pictures but, hey I'm nearly 60 with eyes going bad. That said was worth the $28.48 investment I made, wouldn't pay more but was great!
customer_reviews.author: J.T.

customer_reviews.title: Factory firmware no good, needs Rockbox. High learning curve.
customer_reviews.text: Navigation and interface is not good. Too many problems to list. Unless all your files are perfectly tagged, it's very difficult to find songs (similar to ipod), I prefer folder/filename sorting like on the PC. Play screen is also lacking. Somewhat difficult learning curve for anyone who is not the owner. The factory firmware is overall poor. Installed Rockbox and it is 100x better than the factory firmware. It has basic features it should have had from the factory, plus a million more. However, it also has a learning curve.
customer_reviews.author: James Peter Hill

customer_reviews.title: (Update)Some good things,some not so much.
customer_reviews.text: Nice little unit,about the same as the earlier version.Except I could swear the other one I had was a bit louder.Easy to navigate,easy to find the song,album,artist I want.Overall,id say im pretty happy with it. Ive been playing with it & seems the fm radio does play pretty loud,,just playing from songs down loaded from my computer are not as loud. Didnt even have this thing for a month & the buttons started to become unresponsive.Also you dont want to put it in your pocket,one little nudge & your radio station is gone,or your song gets changed.I loved the older model,never had a problem,dont care for this one.Will switch to some other brand.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel J.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Interface
customer_reviews.text: I've been using Sansa clips for years now and have lost one or two but never had one go bad on me. The interface has improved through successive versions and is straight forward and easy to use. My primary use is for listening to audio books and you can stop in the middle of a song (or file) and return to the same spot when you come back. The device also allows for changing play speed and for deleting files. Overall it does what it's supposed to do and does it well. Definitely superior to the comparably priced devices from it's competitors.
customer_reviews.author: Carolus

customer_reviews.title: upgrade from Sansa Clip...quite good...
customer_reviews.text: goods and cons.. apart from having a colour screen, better radio reception, here are the cons... 1) the menu navigation seems cumbersome. I used to switch better Radio and my mp3 playlist with ease on the older Sansa...but this new colour screen Menu navigation is cumbersome..more clicks, and I can't start the playlist from where I stopped earlier! always have to start the playlist from afresh. 2) bulkier this have become slightly bigger than the older one. 3) buttons design doesnt look right.. still prefer the older one. however, I bought this new version as a cheaper price than the version 1... :P still probably better and more cost effective than Creative or Apple...good job, Sandisk!
customer_reviews.author: Jerome Tan

customer_reviews.title: They always quit on me
customer_reviews.text: Since about 2007 I have purchased, and I am not kidding here- probably at least 8 of these mp3 players. I like them because they are very small (so great for working out), they are not apple (I don't use iTunes), they are easy to use and program, etc. However, in almost every case the mp3 player quit working. Some times after several years of use, sometimes after only a few days. But they just one day won't turn on anymore. I kept buying them because I liked the product otherwise, but I am finally giving up. I will have to find a different mp3 player that will actually last
customer_reviews.author: R.A.E.

customer_reviews.title: Green Screen
customer_reviews.text: I bought this MP3 player years ago (2013) and for a long time, it worked perfectly. But just recently, I get a green screen of death. When I turn it on, it shows the start-up screen logo then switches to solid green and I cannot navigate to the menus. It still charges when connected to my computer, all the music is still accessible, but not when I actually want to use it. Sometimes it pops back to a visible menu but it's not reliable. I've searched message boards and the company website, but there's nothing to be done when it gets the green screen of death. It gets two stars for living so long because now it's useless.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: I liked it,  until it failed
customer_reviews.text: This is second Sansa I've owned and both failed. On the first one, the clip broke off. On my current one, the card reader failed. I mostly listen to podcasts an audio books and the Sansa is great for that. The expandability with a memory card is helpful since podcasts and audio books can be large. But, sadly, I don't have that function any longer. But, the price and features on this player are great. I just wish it didn't fail. I should mention that I don't abuse the unit -- I just use it normally. Mostly indoors, actually. But I do use it every day.
customer_reviews.author: Toomuchnoise

customer_reviews.title: A worthy purchase
customer_reviews.text: The Sansa Clip Zip 4GB player is a marvelous little machine. While tiny (smaller than a credit card) it has great sound output (as long as you're using quality headphones/buds). The video display is adequate to navigate screens and shows you the current song playing. For $30-40 this mp3 player is worth the investment - no frills, fancy equipment or programming; just access to your music anytime anywhere. Due to the size I do recommend getting an armband and silicone casing to prevent accidental loss and damage to the screen. The clip could use some better spring tension but otherwise it's a great addition for convenience.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Houtsch

customer_reviews.title: It was protected with a case and it wasnt in an area where unnecessary pressure could have been applied
customer_reviews.text: one day the screen started randomly bleeding it seemed to complete soled red you couldnt see anything, it took throughout the whole day for it to turn from noticeably discoloured to turning solid red. It was protected with a case and it wasnt in an area where unnecessary pressure could have been applied, it was sitting on the desk and I woke up to that disappointment. Not something I recommend buying if you plan on being able to see anything on the screen. Which I would like to point out ITS HORRIBLE to try to see when its daylight outside and I mean pathetic.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: Still the one!
customer_reviews.text: Not quoting an Orleans tune from decades ago - just stating that my preference for the Sansa Clip still reigns supreme after a very lengthy engagement. Super lightweight and easy to use without even looking at it, clipped to a t-shirt collar or even to my hearing protection earmuffs when I'm shirtless working outdoors with some noisy powered equipment. Capacity is more than ample for my eclectic music needs, and management of songs is super-simple drag & drop. MicroSD card slot makes swapping music a snap too, if you need more room! Still the one for me, for on-the-go music.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy G.

customer_reviews.title: Seemed to break after one week---but just needed to be reset
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this as a Christmas present for our son. It worked fine for one week, then completely stopped working: wouldn't turn on, no response if we connected it to the computer. We contacted SanDisk, and they told us to hold down the power button for 20 seconds or so, then try to turn the player on. We did so, but there was no change: the player was still blank/dead. So we tried it again, and it worked: the player came on with all the songs intact, and has been working normally ever since.
customer_reviews.author: KNV

customer_reviews.title: headphone jack doesn't FIT!
customer_reviews.text: I have an old version of the sandisk player and after 4 years, it unexpectedly died. So i upgraded. the port for the headphone jack on this version was TOO shallow and didn't make a good connection - so i had to return it. I purchased another one that looked identical on amazon to my old one - and it had the same problem - the port was TOO shallow and headphones didn't make a secure connection - had to return that one too. Very frustrating. it's not the seller's fault - it is the fault of sandisk.
customer_reviews.author: S Farmer

customer_reviews.title: TOTALLY USER UN-FRIENDLY
customer_reviews.text: It has been a nightmare to get my music in, every time I transfer more than 2-3Gb to the external memory (Also Sandisk, by the way), the "refreshing" of the media takes for ever, restarting doesn't work and even getting the computer to recognize the device is difficult. The last time, when, after more than 6 times transmitting files in "packages" of 2- 3 Gb, the device just stopped working, and wouldn't get recognize by the computer.If you want this mp3 player for just carring 2-3Gb, Ok, get, but if you want to take your 20 - 30Gb of music everywhere, DON'T GET THIS CHEAP PIECE OF CRAP
customer_reviews.author: Rubén Rodríguez

customer_reviews.title: much better options out-there
customer_reviews.text: Ridiculously expensive for what you get, the only real advantage compared to other MP3s is its very small size, but for the little piece of fragile plastic that it is the price should be $11.99. Don't buy this, there are much, much better options out-there.
customer_reviews.author: Raf

customer_reviews.title: Bad Bad Product Unstable Foremat
customer_reviews.text: software locks, up not enough info to reboot. I returned it because screen would not respond. I am still charged a restocking fee. Prompted to sign up to Rhapsody which costs $10.00 a month which I will not use. I have my music on my computer ready to load to a MP3 Player. Sansa products have a history of being lacking and user unfriendly as per my friends of which several returned to store or Amazon. I work as a programmer and this is the most unstable software I have encountered with the least support ,I am still wondering why I am charged a restocking charge
customer_reviews.author: Bob Toupin

customer_reviews.title: you have to use rhapsody...
customer_reviews.text: To make playlist and save them to your sandisk mp3 player, you are forced to use rhapsody music software. I think it is wrong for a mp3 player to force people to use one company to make a playlist. I've read articles online about ways to get around this but those are a lot of trouble when you could simply buy something that doesn't force you to use rhapsody. Also the description should make it known that only rhapsody will work for playlist creation. Other than the above, its a good mp3 player for the price you pay.
customer_reviews.author: PixieStick

customer_reviews.title: Good Value In A Little Package
customer_reviews.text: I love this little gadget. I often use it outside while landscaping and also while doing chores in the house, going from room to room, and of course while exercising. I enjoy being able to switch between the radio,audio books, and my own downloaded music albums,Sunday sermons,etc. I also bought a 16GB Sandisk Sd card and an arm band. This is my first gadget like this since the days of the old Walkman FM- Cassette player which was eight times larger. That was replaced by a 20GB Dell DJ when they first came out about eight years ago. Now the Dell is relagated to back up duty.
customer_reviews.author: eroz

customer_reviews.title: nice music player
customer_reviews.text: I needed a music player that didn't have a camera on it because I can't have cameras at my job. and after getting over the fact that it wasn't an apple product so it wouldn't just sync perfectly with my iTunes, I found that this music player is pretty sweet. The sound is pretty good even with the headphones they give you. so for going to the gym or running this things does the job and loading it with music is super easy. just drag and drop. i don't know if i will ever need to put more memory into it but i can if i need to with the sd card slot.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Millard

customer_reviews.title: Not Compatible with Audible Audiobooks if you have a MAC!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Though this product says that it is compatible with Audible audiobooks and Mac, what the product description fails to tell you is that you cannot transfer Audible books to this device from a Mac. Apparently you can transfer audiobooks to an MP3 player using iTunes (onto an iPod) or using Audible's proprietary software, which works exclusively on Windows. It's a small, but important detail, especially since I bought this product for the sole purpose of listening to audiobooks.
customer_reviews.author: Blippity Bloo

customer_reviews.title: This is Not Worth $100!!!
customer_reviews.text: I do not know why these jackals are putting the price up. I bought this for $70 about 6 months ago and now its $100. This thing is slow to skip songs and does not add your new songs to the recently added list. And yes my sansa is up to date and the power button always gets accidentally pressed and the power button is broken and fell off into the mp3 in a month of use. I now have to turn the mp3 player on by plugging it to the the computer by the usb drive.
customer_reviews.author: ACR505

customer_reviews.title: Great MP3 player
customer_reviews.text: I purchased several of these, as well as the earlier model (clip+) I like both, but this uses micro usb vs mini usb (p.s. I was able to use a 64GB card in this device despite the website stating it only supports up to 32GB, FYI) Pros: Great size The clip works very well Plays everything I can throw at it can use with Audible and Overdrive Universal micro-usb charging slot ...Many more Cons: Freezes up from time to time (Fix-press and hold the back and power key together for 10+sec. This resets it, than press power and all your stuff is right there)
customer_reviews.author: STEVEN

customer_reviews.title: WORKS FINE!
customer_reviews.text: This TINY ipod like player does all it says. It has fine audio...fairly easy access to songs. Allows for additional media storage with a microcard. The one issue I have... It claims I should use RHAPSODY..but to enable copying the Rhapsody software into this unit to make song access EASIER...it asks I BUY a Rhapsody subsxription. Sorry. NO. I have been unable to copy other song software..such as Itunes or similar into the unit to make song lists, playlists, song title access easier...but otherwise the unit operates and the sound is quite good for its size.
customer_reviews.author: DICK YORK IS THE BETTER DICK

customer_reviews.title: Does the job nicely
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for something small & lightweight that clips onto clothes to use for running music. I had previously used a Shuffle, but with only 2 GB, it didn't hold all of my music. This SanDisk holds all my music with room to spare. The sound is pretty good if you use your own ear piece rather than the ones that come with it. That is - once you master the use of the EQ. The only thing I don't like about it is... it's rather difficult navigating between menus....a lot of "back arrow" pushing to get from one thing to another. But, for the price, it's nice.
customer_reviews.author: ms kimba

customer_reviews.title: still the best
customer_reviews.text: Had to buy another one... there is no other product that can match this one!! I might have to buy another one just for backup because it is harder and harder to find this!!
customer_reviews.author: gerard fabian

customer_reviews.title: Defective item received! Very low volume!
customer_reviews.text: Even after a full battery charge and with volume adjusted to max the music was just barely audible. Furthermore, seating the provided ear buds completely caused one of the channels to die. The jack required pulling out just slightly before the left channel would work. Similar story when I connected the Clip Zip to my car audio system. With the Clip Zip's volume set to max and the car stereo volume set to max audio wasn't intelligible with the engine running. A+ to Amazon for they're prompt shipping and outstanding return policy but the Clip Zip doesn't cut it as an MP3 player.
customer_reviews.author: kaba

customer_reviews.title: Lesson learned, I should have listened to my inner voice
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality is non-existent. The volume is so low I can barely hear it when doing my laundry over the fans that are running. I thought since I have it I can use it for workouts until I can find a better player. Now when I charge it, the charge last for about two songs before the player displays the message "shutting down" I assume because the battery has been exhausted. I will take my time finding a replacement. Nothing beats the Creative X-Fi and X-Fi2 I had as far as sound quality and now Creative no longer has their MP3 player available, except the over-priced ones on E-Bay.
customer_reviews.author: Dutchman7

customer_reviews.title: Mini Mini!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a big fan of mini music players, especially mp3 players because I like the drag and drop for transferring files. I had a white one (older version) that lasted me for 3+ years but I decided to upgrade because of the price and color!! Pros: Mp3/WMA formats, Radio, Voice Recorder, Displays album art, small and portable I'm not a fan of the clip because it has the tendency to break, I wish it had one of the slots where you can hook it to a key-chain or something. One slight difference besides the screen for the hard drive, the USB port is smaller compared to the older version.
customer_reviews.author: InfiniteBloo

customer_reviews.title: Player doesn't transfer files as described.
customer_reviews.text: My husband spent four hours just trying to download music from his computer to my kid's players. He is pretty tech savvy. The problem was that the players would not accept any other file type except mp3 files despite it advertises that other formats can be transferred. We were worried it was just going to be an expensive radio player. Pros: Affordable Stylish Compact Delivers good sound Decent battery life So far has made it through a few drops Cons: Freezes up frequently which may erase albums already uploaded. Will not save mp3 player name Hard to transfer files Cheap earbuds
customer_reviews.author: Lizzette

customer_reviews.title: Working well for me so far!
customer_reviews.text: Have had this a few months now and have no complaints so far. It is my first MP3 player though so I have nothing to compare it too. All I can say is it was significantly cheaper than many others I saw, but it has been working fine for my purposes. However I don't use it often at all right now, so it hasn't had much opportunity to fail either ...so take my review with a grain of salt :) It worked great to have music to play on a boat cruise event I hosted this summer. Loading my playlists to it was very easy. I am happy with it so far and hopefully it stays that way :)
customer_reviews.author: K. Toussaint

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: This is a great mp3 player for runners, really small and good battery life, the sound quality is great with good headphones, the pair included with the player are uggly and a little uncomfortable. The two matters that i hate from this player is that after insert the microsd card (32gb with only 10 gb with music) or after add some new songs to the player the system rebuilt the information from the entire library and it takes about 10 minutes, the other bad thing is that the 3.5mm jack (for headphones) is so hard the first time i think that the player was defective but after some use i get familiar with this.
customer_reviews.author: Abraham Arturo Meza Marin

customer_reviews.title: Been great during workouts
customer_reviews.text: I have sweat all over this thing while doing anything from lifting, running or working the heavy bag and it is still blasting my favorite metal workout tunes! Seriously this is one boss mp3 player, granted I did flash over to rockbox firmware on day 1 because sandisk firmware is too. . . simple but that's just for my taste which is why I only gave it a 4 star instead of 5. All in all this is an amazing workout product that won't break the bank to replace if you happen to break it. oh and I forgot the battery life is insane I'm able to go around a week (about an hour each day) without charging.
customer_reviews.author: The IT Guy

customer_reviews.title: Good for MP3, not for recording radio.
customer_reviews.text: I mainly purchased this unit to record FM radio. It does but during playback it skips. The skips must be recorded directly into the audio file as they happen at the same place every time during playback. Regardless if I play the recorded audio back directly fom the device or transfer it onto my computer the skips are still there. This also happens with voice recording as well. Otherwise if you are looking for a simple, low cost MP3 player then this is a good buy. The charge lasts longer than any device that I have owned of this size.
customer_reviews.author: Practigal

customer_reviews.title: Great Item
customer_reviews.text: Folks you can not go wrong with this MP3 player. Holds 4 gig plus another 32 gig on a card but will not support 64 gig as if that should matter.Sounds great and price is right the one I purchased was a "refurb" and although I was not aware of it at the time I would have gotten it anyway. Cons- buttons are small and would be great for a southpaw as they feel wrong for a righty the clip is somewhat of a pain so I took (broke) it off and fabricated a small holder. Nice little item. I even purchased a second one so that I can have ALL my photos and music.
customer_reviews.author: ShorePatrol

customer_reviews.title: Sansa Clip
customer_reviews.text: Had one of these players at least a year and a half but lost it and wanted to replace it and my problem with this one was that it was the second Sansa product that had some issue with it since trying to replace the one . Having had an MP3 like this one I knew it was a good product but it stopped working a week after getting it . It would not even turn on so there was no way to troubleshoot and since changing batteries on these things cannot be done without nullifying the warranty so I could not even try that .
customer_reviews.author: marta

customer_reviews.title: I like it but....
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace an ipod shuffle because I really really hate iTunes. My primary usage of the SanDisk Sansa Clip is when I run. It's incredibly light weight and easy to transfer and manage music. My main complaint with this is skipping and managing volume when I'm on runs. Often times the device will go into various menus which will negate my ability to skip songs and force me to unclip to navigate the menus. I think it was definitely worth it getting away from iTunes, but I think Sansa still has an iteration or two to go before this meets its full potential.
customer_reviews.author: M. Roehl

customer_reviews.title: Clip zip 4gb mp3 player
customer_reviews.text: WOW,better than expected for the size.Great sound and the speakers connect to my motorcycle helmet earphone intercom system. The supplied speakers do a great job,no need for me to buy any others. I connected the clip to my computer speakers and the sound is really great there as well. 4GB is more than enough storage space for me and I have an 8GB micro loaded with Cusco music that sounds awesome! Why pay bigger bucks when these do such a great job? They look and feel high quality to me,and the big clip is doing its job of staying where I clip it,usually a shirt pocket.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and and compact
customer_reviews.text: Compact and still have plenty of room for massive amounts of content even with all the music I've collected over the years
customer_reviews.author: TaniaIdes10

customer_reviews.title: What do you need in a player?
customer_reviews.text: I have seen many people hand-carrying or wearing various players, and realize that player choice is really a personal matter. In our price range, we found the Sansa Clip Zip 4GB MP3 player scored high in quality and function. In fact, we were happy enough with the first one to buy a second. Highlights: small / lightweight, simple physical controls operable even by large fingers, micro SD slot, broad range of formats, good playback. For us, the Sansa Clip Zip did not have a downside, though it comes with ear buds I personally would not give away; again, personal. We replaced them with Sony Ultra Lightweight headphones (MDR-W08L) which are comfortable and work well.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: My third Sansa Clip Zip
customer_reviews.text: I love this player. Not just cause its tiny. Not just cause it's got a clip. It comes in great colors, it works with Rhapsody to Go (which is hard to find these days). It holds plenty of music, plus you can see album art (which I love) and a charge lasts a good long time. They die from time to time. Probably sooner than they should. But then I just buy another one used or refurbished for around $20. I keep hoping they'll make an updated version of this player that lasts but until then I'll just keep buying this one over and over again. I need my phone juice for phone stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn

customer_reviews.title: portable music player
customer_reviews.text: I like the product but the disc that came with it is completely useless and had a "general behavior thread virus" attached within, caught by my AVG security suite. Rhapsody seemed to be the vector which is a paid service? but the disc sansa part wouldnot register me either and why does that come with my purchase, I really disliked that. I contacted SanDisk and they emailed me some links. not too helpful. I did however manage to get the "plug n play" to actually plug and play cheesy ear buds. shipped immediately, good packaging not excessive but could do without the molded plastic holder.
customer_reviews.author: magda liska

customer_reviews.title: Finally a GOOD one!
customer_reviews.text: I've been through 4 MP3 players since the Archos unit I loved so much gave up the ghost. The Sandisk Sansa Clip fills in all the missing holes of the Archos and the size is one quarter of the original. Expandable memory to 32 gb and I'm set for a long time of music with no repeats. Easy to use, beautiful sound (with good quality over the ears phones) I recommend this one for a first time or like me trying to separate the garbage out there from the quality. Thank you Sandisk for a perfect new player. You've got me for life!
customer_reviews.author: Chuck the Moderator

customer_reviews.title: Small, easy to use, exactly what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a small, easy to use MP3 player for when I run. I was using an IPod Classic with an arm band for years and the arm band broke recently. While it was OK, I wanted something smaller, no need for an armband, and could maintain a playlist or two. This device fit the bill perfectly and the price was right. It is nice to have the screen where I can see what song is playing. The buttons are easy to access and use - they are stiff enough that they do not accidentally get pushed. The clip is a nice addition - no band or pockets needed, just clip it on and go.
customer_reviews.author: Rita

customer_reviews.title: Works as intended
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised at how small the device is. It is also pretty light. The clip helps a lot as it frees a hand (I previously had a MP3 player that lacked a clip). I listen to music walking to and from work. I find the battery life is perfectly adequate for this purpose and have not tested its limits (my walk is maybe 20-25 minutes one-way). The device has way more space than I need though I have not yet tried out some of the other functions. The fact you can use microSD in it for more storage is nice, if I ever found a need for more space.
customer_reviews.author: Russell

customer_reviews.title: Perfectly simple.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this to replace my older Sansa Clip that finally gave out after years of heavy use. I love how small and light these are, they are perfect for working out and for traveling. The controls are very simple, so it's easy to navigate while running/biking/etc. Holds enough music on its own, and can use a micro SD to add more. The headphone jack was extremely snug when it showed up - you have to really force the headphones in the first few times, but it loosens up after that. You'll hear a distinct 'click' when it does snap in all the way - it won't break the player.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Not quite the sound
customer_reviews.text: I had a smaller Mp3 with much less space for music. This one has a ton of perks.. like the ability to have audio books. I love the option of the radio, I have that with my other Mp3. I do like that it separates the albums. I can play one at a time or scramble. Love that! Just very disappointed that the sound is so low. I believe Sandisk could make that better. My RCA blew my ears off on half volume. Not sure if I would purchase another for that reason. I can barely hear over the lawn mower and I have great hearing. Not for someone whose hearing is limited. Sorry
customer_reviews.author: T.R.

customer_reviews.title: I love this little thing!
customer_reviews.text: We are living in an age that our fore-fathers could never have dreamed of. Isn't technology great? And it just keeps coming. I know these have been around a long time but still. It sure does the job at the gym. I just clip it to my sweats and away I go on cardio. (Hey I rhymed) It has good bass and with a desent pair of earbuds, you're all set. Just drop/drag to the device, or put in a folder. Whatever you want. Make playlists. Love SanDisk for their micro storage so I thought they would make a pretty good MP3 player. I was right.
customer_reviews.author: Rayca

customer_reviews.title: It Does What It Does & It Does It Well!
customer_reviews.text: I always liked the Sansa iPods as THE alternative to -- uh .... iPods. Anyhoo, I've had all 3 now -- SansaClip/SansaClip+/SansaClipZip -- and while the first 2 always had wierd loading problems [in the case of theSansaClip+, songs, sometimes, would just not load, period.], the SansaClipZip, so far, anyway, just drags 'n drops, and then plays, the songs, bingbangboom. The radio & voice/radio recorder works well, too. If somebody, for whatever reason, doesn't wanna deal with Apple's "ecosystem" and asked for my opinion as to what iPod to get in it's stead, I would immediately recommend SanDisk's "Sansa" line: specifically the "SansaClipZip". It's inexpensive *and* it works really well. What more could you possibly ask for?
customer_reviews.author: CaryMGVR

customer_reviews.title: SanDisk Sansa Clip Zip * GB MP3 Player SDMX22-008G-A57G-Grey Color
customer_reviews.text: The purchase of this SanDisk Sansa Clip Zip * GB MP3 Player SDMX22-008G-A57G-Grey Color on my part was to provide me with a sound source to feed into amplifier and speaker projects to test them for sound delivery. I probably won't use it as others will to play music into a set of ear buds, but maybe I'll use it that way more when it is not in my work bench area. I stores a lot of different music to choose from for my purpose of sound testing and does provide a dependable source of sound. Sounds as good as an MP3 can sound as far as I can tell. Battery life could be better between charges.
customer_reviews.author: CDP's Onceagain habit of purchasingTop Contributor: Guitars

customer_reviews.title: Was never delivered to me
customer_reviews.text: This item was never delivered to me. What strikes me as odd, is that there are other things that I've ordered before AND after that have made it here. This item (and some others that I've left the SAME review for) were not delivered to me. They stated that the address is "undeliverable". That's VERY odd considering that I ordered things AFTER this purchase and received them just fine. Thanks for nothing. I would have liked to have received an email letting me know that you thought the address was wrong so that I could help you clear up the matter before hand. Thanks to Amazon for refunding things promptly though. I do appreciate that. I still think it's crap.
customer_reviews.author: James C Ryder

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this thing!! Best thing I have ever bought! Can't believe something this cool is so cheap!! I have every CD I ever bought, plus more on this thing. Hasn't let me down yet! I cancelled my satellite subscription and saved $100's!! I used to use it on a motorcycle I owned prior - was great having all my tunes out in the wind! Now it resides in my truck 99% of the time. Always hear awesome music at the touch of a button, all automatically. Got to love technology!
customer_reviews.author: Smithsonite

customer_reviews.title: adequate
customer_reviews.text: Easy to transfer audio books and music from computer to device. When I transferred an additional audio book, it was hard to find my place in the audio book I was listening to until I figured out to transfer the audio books from "music" to "audio books" on the SanDisk Sansa via the file folders in Windows Explorer. The FM antenna is in the ear-bud wire. Only one ear-bud works (great sound) but not worth my time to send it back. I would like a "loop" on it for use with a lanyard or safety strap as it is very small and easily misplaced on my desk and in my purse.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: Great things can come in small packages
customer_reviews.text: Bought this mp3 player for my husband and he just loves it! He enjoys the option to listen to radio or play his music. It clips securely to his shirt and away he goes! The controls are fairly intuitive and the print is large enough to be a help. So far, the only drawbacks have been that mp3s ripped from two of our cds wouldn't play on it - though they play on the computer and on my iPod (all the others worked) - and the need to change a default setting so it wouldn't rename folders according to some arcane idea of its own. The instructions to change from auto to MSC mode are easy to Google :)
customer_reviews.author: Shushan

customer_reviews.title: Player broke after few months.
customer_reviews.text: I bought 1 of these for myself because I liked how it clipped onto your clothes and then my friend saw it and wanted 1 to use at his work, so I purchased one for him. I am kinda embarrassed that I recommended this player to my friend because after I purchased his mine broke within a few months. Then a few months after my friend having his it also broke. Both would come on but do nothing. Mine amazon kindly replaced because it was still under the return time. Unfortunately my friend is out his money because his broke right after.
customer_reviews.author: LAS

customer_reviews.title: Great little Music Player
customer_reviews.text: The SanDisk Sansa Clip music player (plays all kinds of file types) is a compact (~1.5 X 3 inch) masterpiece! Navigation on the bright little screen is well-thought-out and intuitive. Battery life is truly ~ five hours or more - depending on play volume, I suppose. Loading the SanDisk was fun. You can either load out of Media Player, or - when you plug in the player via the supplied USB connector, a whole import utility loads up and provides for import options. In short, this is a product that works well-beyond your expectations. And this price here at Amazon is fabulous!
customer_reviews.author: P. D. Worley

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working for no reason.. no abuse to product at all.. and then replacement malfunctioned as well!!
customer_reviews.text: Was nice while it worked.. Never dropped it nor got it wet yet it just stopped working 5 months after I received it!! Unfortunately it was no longer eligible for a return through the vendor BUT it was returnable through the manufacturer... The thing is after they replaced it I had issues with the replacement. The replacement would turn off by itself during my moderate workouts, and then the auxiliary headphone jack had a shortage in it. It wasn't my headphones because I used three different sets.
customer_reviews.author: E. Barren

customer_reviews.title: Perfect player for audiobooks
customer_reviews.text: I subscribe to audiobooks from audibles.com and used to listen to them on my kindle until about a year later when my audio stopped working. I found listening to audiobooks on the kindle very clumsy and awkward. I discovered this Sansa clip player based on a recommendation made by another audiobook enthusiast. Very nice form factor, simple to use, great bargain for its price. Battery doesn't last as long as the kindle, about 2-3 hrs of play time, but expected given its form factor. Also I couldn't get my audibles windows app software to transfer my audio files over, but Win 7 MS media player had no problems. Audible.com needs to update their ancient windows app, it's really outdated.
